str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, entire, complete. A primary word; 'whole' or 'all', i.e. Complete, especially as noun or adverb.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To set in motion, move, remove, excite, stir up. From kio; to stir, literally or figuratively.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a people.
A running together, concourse, mob. From suntrecho; a running together, i.e. concourse.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To lay hold of, take hold of, seize (sometimes with beneficent, sometimes with hostile, intent).
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To drag, draw, pull, persuade, unsheathe. Or helko hel'-ko; probably akin to haireomai; to drag.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Without, outside. Adverb from ek; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of hieros; a sacred place, i.e. The entire precincts of the Temple.
And, even, also, namely.
Immediately, soon, at once. Adverb from euthus; directly, i.e. At once or soon.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) a door, (b) met: an opportunity. Apparently a primary word; a portal or entrance.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To shut, shut up. A primary verb; to close.
